intro: Anisopappus chinensis subsp. lobatus, commonly known as the Chinese lobed groundsel, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lobed and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
